alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Aroostook County through 400 PM EDT... At 329 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Frenchville to Big Machias Lake. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Caribou, Madawaska, Van Buren, Eagle Lake, Portage, Mapleton, Washburn, Ashland, Woodland, Frenchville, Portage Lake, New Canada, Masardis, Oxbow, Russel Crossing, Lille, Cross Lake, Big Machias Lake, Madawaska Lake and Nashville Plantation. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Van Buren and Grand Isle. State Highway 11 between Squapan and Winterville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
